text: How long does it take to create a website?
text2:
It takes from 4 weeks to 6 months to create a site. It depends on many factors, such as the complexity of the work and the technologies used for creating:
1. Work complexity: one page, many pages, landing page, e-commerce site.
2. Technologies used to create the site:
- HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP and graphic editors (creation practically from scratch).
- Templates, frameworks, stock photos, and other ready-made solutions that speed up development.
- Special website creation software or website creation platform.
- CMS and CMS templates.

Note: This is a short list of what can affect build speed; this list does not include many other things.


From research:
===
5 minutes (AI site builder platform)
few hours (blog platform, CMS)
few days - few week (CMS template)
1 week - 3 months (website builder platform).
4 weeks - 6 months (professional developer)
2 - 6 months (web design agency)


Sources:

- How long does it take to build a website? Here’s what to expect https://www.wix.com/blog/how-long-does-it-take-to-build-a-website 
- How Long Does it Take to Build a Website in 2024 https://www.hostinger.com/tutorials/how-long-it-takes-to-create-website
- How Long Does It Take to Make a Website? – Go WordPress https://wordpress.com/go/website-building/how-long-does-it-take-to-make-a-website/

===

What is web design?

Web design is a type of digital design that creates and maintains websites. Web design is responsible for how the site should look: colors, fonts (typography), graphics and user interface.


Web design includes:

- Graphic design.
- User interface design (UI design).
- User experience design (UX design).
- Search engine optimization (SEO).

What is the difference between web design and web development?

- Web design is more responsible for the visual side of how the site should look.
- Web development is front-end development that implements web design into a ready-to-use site. Web development includes: HTML - hypertext markup language, CSS - cascading style sheets language, and JavaScript (JS) programming language.


Sources:

Web design - Wikipedia https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Web_design
What Is Web Design? A Comprehensive Guide https://www.wix.com/blog/web-design 
Web Design Explained: Key Elements & Best Practices | Figma https://www.figma.com/resource-library/web-design/ 


Trends:
======
Sustainable Web Design⁠ (Reducing the digital carbon footprint).
Responsive Web Design (A site for any screen).
Custom Illustrations (Not stock photos).
Micro-interactions (Respond to user actions).
Clean and minimalist visual design (Simplification).
Denser, richer graphics (More complex, colourful, textures).

Sources:
7 emerging web design trends for 2024 and beyond https://webflow.com/blog/web-design-trends-2024

text: My thoughts on web design and web dev (in progress)
text2:
About CSS
=========

- The default value in CSS does not need to be changed, these are ready-made, well-thought-out solutions that can be used, for changes there is "id" and "class".


Principles of page style:
===================

 - Simplicity and cleanliness, so that there are no unnecessary elements and this gives an opportunity to concentrate attention on the content.

- Without a lot of space between the elements, I think it looks bad and not compact, although I'm more likely to be wrong.

- When the design is clean and simple, it is attractive at first. After a while, it becomes boring, so I want to see different colors, pages with pictures or illustrations, and backgrounds with textures or pages with background images.
